title: Syncing go packages with golang release tags.
body:
by **cdunn2001**: 
I'm not certain of this, but at least hear me out.

I am trying to use `goinstall` on various packages. The system works well, but not all
packages can be built with the latest tip of golang. I was forced to switch back to the
most recent release of golang itself.

It seems to me that the defaults should all "just work", and there should be a
way to try everything with the latest code as well. It's impossible to guarantee that
the latest versions of packages are compatible with each other, let alone with the
latest version of golang. People seem to sync on the latest *release* of golang, but how
do we *know* which release of golang is expected?

I was hoping at least to start a discussion. Or am I (and many package maintainers)
simply ignorant of some configuration settings?
